ins.il: plural in form but singular or plural in construction

dt: {bc}the art or science concerned with guiding or influencing governmental {a_link|policy}
{bc}the art or science concerned with winning and holding control over a government
{bc}competition between competing interest groups or individuals for power and leadership (as in a government)
{bc}political life especially as a principal activity or profession
{bc}political activities characterized by artful and often dishonest practices
{bc}the political opinions or sympathies of a person
{bc}the total complex of relations between people living in society
{bc}relations or conduct in a particular area of experience especially as seen or dealt with from a political point of view

et: Middle English {it}Polletiques, Polytykys,{/it} as title of Aristotle's {it}Politics,{/it} from {it}polit{/it}ik "of spiritual or secular governance, political" + {it}-iques, -ykys{/it} {et_link|-ics|-ics}, after Middle French {it}politiques, polliticques{/it} and Medieval Latin {it}polītica,{/it} after Greek {it}tà politiká{/it} "public matters, civic affairs," from neuter plural of {it}politikós{/it} "of citizens, civic, of a state, political, public" {ma}{mat|politic|}{/ma}
shortdef: the art or science of government
the art or science concerned with guiding or influencing governmental policy
the art or science concerned with winning and holding control over a government

ins.il: plural in form but singular or plural in construction

dt: {bc}reaction against or rejection of the practices or attitudes associated with traditional politics

dt.t: Tories know that recession and the rise of {wi}anti-politics{/wi}, stoked by stories of Westminster sleaze, means that loathing for the government does not imply love for its opponents.
{wi}Antipolitics{/wi} served up by a well-heeled conservative who looks like an outsider will probably beat the new politics the Greens are still trying to invent.

shortdef: reaction against or rejection of the practices or attitudes associated with traditional politics

ins.il: plural in form but singular or plural in construction

dt: {bc}politics in which groups of people having a particular racial, religious, ethnic, social, or cultural identity tend to promote their own specific interests or concerns without regard to the interests or concerns of any larger political group

dt.t: Although the UCLA center's standards promoted rigorous history, they set off a major culture war because of their relentless emphasis on {wi}identity politics{/wi}.

{wi}Identity politics{/wi} is contemporary shorthand for a group's assertion that it is a meaningful group; that it differs significantly from other groups; that its members share a history of injustice and grievance; and that its psychological and political mission is to explore, act out, act on and act up its group identity.
A number of critics have viewed her work through a lens of {wi}identity politics{/wi}, taking her to be some sort of oracle of Muslim womanhood.

shortdef: politics in which groups of people having a particular racial, religious, ethnic, social, or cultural identity tend to promote their own specific interests or concerns without regard to the interests or concerns of any larger political group

ins.il: plural in form but singular or plural in construction

dt: {bc}politics based primarily on the use of power (such as military and economic strength) as a coercive force rather than on ethical precepts

shortdef: politics based primarily on the use of power (such as military and economic strength) as a coercive force rather than on ethical precepts

dt: {bc}to get a job that involves politics

shortdef: to get a job that involves politics

dt: {bc}to get a job that involves politics

shortdef: to get a job that involves politics

dt: {bc}the activities, attitudes, or behaviors that are used to get or keep power or an advantage within a business or company

shortdef: the activities, attitudes, or behaviors that are used to get or keep power or an advantage within a business or company

dt: {bc}political activities, decisions, etc., that relate to or support a particular political party

dt.t: {it}Party politics{/it} played a large role in determining who would be chosen for the position.

shortdef: political activities, decisions, etc., that relate to or support a particular political party

dt: {bc}to say or do things for political reasons instead of doing what is right or what is best for other people

dt.t: She's been accused of {it}playing politics{/it} with the investigation.

shortdef: to say or do things for political reasons instead of doing what is right or what is best for other people
